uniol.apt.generator.tnet

Class TNetGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.generator.tnet.TNetGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<PetriNet>

    public class TNetGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<PetriNet>
    A generator which creates all t-nets with less than the given number of places and transitions. This generator does not generate isolated transitions. The TNetIterator implements the actual logic of this class. This generator can get wrapped by the IsolatedTransitionsGenerator to get t-nets which can contain isolated elements and by the {link uniol.apt.generator.marking.MarkingNetGenerator} to get t-systems.
    Author:
    vsp, Uli Schlachter

    • Constructor Detail

      • TNetGenerator

        public TNetGenerator(int maxPlaces)
        Create a TNetGenerator for all t-nets with at most maxPlaces places. There is no limit for the number of transitions in the generated petri nets. However, in a t-net each place has exactly one transition in its preset and one in its postset. Since no isolated elements are allowed, this means that 2*maxPlaces is a limit for the transition count.
        Parameters:
        maxPlaces - the limit for the number of places in the generated petri nets.

      • TNetGenerator

        public TNetGenerator(int maxPlaces,
                     boolean additionalTransitions)
        Create a TNetGenerator for all t-nets with at most maxPlaces places. There is no limit for the number of transitions in the generated petri nets. However, in a t-net each place has exactly one transition in its preset and one in its postset. Since no isolated elements are allowed, this means that 2*maxPlaces is a limit for the transition count.
        Parameters:
        maxPlaces - the limit for the number of places in the generated petri nets.
        additionalTransitions - should additional transitions get generated in the place preset generation part.

      • TNetGenerator

        public TNetGenerator(int maxPlaces,
                     boolean additionalTransitions,
                     boolean exactTransitionCount)
        Create a TNetGenerator for all t-nets with at most maxPlaces places. There is no limit for the number of transitions in the generated petri nets. However, in a t-net each place has exactly one transition in its preset and one in its postset. Since no isolated elements are allowed, this means that 2*maxPlaces is a limit for the transition count.
        Parameters:
        maxPlaces - the limit for the number of places in the generated petri nets.
        additionalTransitions - should additional transitions get generated in the place preset generation part.
        exactTransitionCount - Don't generate a list with fewer than maxTransitions transitions in the first step.

      • TNetGenerator

        public TNetGenerator(int maxPlaces,
                     int maxTransitions)
        Create a TNetGenerator which generates all t-nets smaller than the given size limits.
        Parameters:
        maxPlaces - the maximum number of places in the generated nets.
        maxTransitions - the limit for the transition count for the generated nets.

      • TNetGenerator

        public TNetGenerator(int maxPlaces,
                     int maxTransitions,
                     boolean additionalTransitions,
                     boolean exactTransitionCount)
        Create a TNetGenerator which generates all t-nets smaller than the given size limits.
        Parameters:
        maxPlaces - the maximum number of places in the generated nets.
        maxTransitions - the limit for the transition count for the generated nets.
        additionalTransitions - should additional transitions get generated in the place preset generation part.
        exactTransitionCount - Don't generate a list with fewer than maxTransitions transitions in the first step.
